description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

Our team’s vision is to provide connectivity for all Googlers by providing high capacity, cost effective and quality focused bandwidth. Specifically, the Corporate Network Acquisition (CNA) team’s responsibilities are to identify, plan, and manage bandwidth opportunities for Google’s Corporate Network and other business units. In this role, you will use your experience in program management to organize multiple projects and meet timelines, focusing in the telecommunications industry, market, and technology.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience in project management, analysis, and/or capacity planning.
  • Experience in finance operations and order to cash operations.
  • Experience in credit risk analyses.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 5 years of experience in the telecommunications industry.
  • Experience with IP transit/peering, dark fiber, wavelengths, and peering x-connects.
  • Experience with various carrier/collocation products and services in an operational, engineering, or implementation role.
  • Ability to manage multiple assignments simultaneously, work independently, and drive projects to completion with minimum guidance and high attention to detail.
responsibilities:
• Acquire network bandwidth for Google Corporate offices, ensuring delivery at the right time and cost, and evaluate bandwidth, technical and other service requirements with partner teams based on several input criteria. Develop, grow, manage, and leverage vendor (ISP) relationships.
  • Work with other teams to ensure project success (i.e., deployment) and work closely with partner teams to understand and cater for all local, regional, and global dependencies. Develop/update internal/cross-functional processes and develop projects to benefit the regional/global team.
  • Achieve best technical/time/resilience/diversity solutions for multiple corporate connections across the Americas region. Create business case/justifications for agreements, reflecting financial and business values.
  • Provide proactive services under deadlines and life cycle management of at/near term circuits through clear, competitive procurement processes. Work with challenging timelines and manage the responsibility of receiving the purchased services on time/to specification.
  • Develop clear technical solutions, based on current engineering standards and requirements that meet the needs of the user and solve all roadblocks that could otherwise prevent successful delivery of services. Develop longer term forecast requirements for offices, sub-regions, and regions and create regional strategies to meet medium to long-term network requirements.
title: Program Manager, Corporate Network Acquisition
